overview:
Doreen Bloch is the CEO & Founder of Poshly.com. She is also the Author of “The Coolest Startups in America,” the first mainstream book on startups (published February 2012).

Doreen is a graduate of the University of California, Berkeley (Class of 2010), where she was awarded the Jack Larson Fellowship for Entrepreneurship & Innovation for her work founding BARE magazine, one of the nation’s first collegiate fashion publications. She was a three-time Yahoo! Inc. intern during college, and after graduation she worked at SecondMarket, where she helped on auctions for shares of pre-IPO companies, including Facebook Inc.

Doreen is the winner of L’Oreal’s NEXT Generation Women in Digital Award (July 2012), and is a member of the Young Entrepreneur Council. Her work is regularly featured by publications such as The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times, Forbes, Inc., ForbesWoman, Feministing, Women 2.0, and more.
